revised_title: The Influence of Electrical Stimulus Intensity and Form on Reflex Effects of Afferent Nerves
tldr: This study investigates the effects of varying electrical stimulus intensity and form on the reflex responses of afferent nerves in decerebrate mammals. The researchers found that weak stimuli tend to produce reflex contraction, while stronger stimuli cause reflex inhibition. They also discovered that galvanic currents are more effective in inducing reflex contraction compared to faradic stimulation.
